poem:
"Across the Narrow Divide"

An iron serenity binds land to land,
Yet clashing hopes conspire to fray its band.
Words phase in, shaded with ink and sweat,
A fragile promise, a reticent bet,
On crossings promised, both rail and bridge,
On the lip of dearth, the edge of privilege.
Monotony stitched in the ticking time,
Solace found in diplomacy's chiming rhyme.
